meanings.definition: To bring under municipal control or ownership.
meanings.sent1: The city decided to municipalize the water supply for better management.
meanings.sent2: The town council voted to municipalize the public transportation system.
meanings.sent3: Why did the mayor want to municipalize the park's maintenance? To save money!
meanings.sent4: The decision to municipalize the waste disposal services was a game-changer for the community.
meanings.sent5: The effort to municipalize the street lighting system was met with great support from the residents.

meanings.sent1: The government's plan is to municipalize the rural area and establish a new town.
meanings.sent2: The goal is to municipalize the region and provide better services to the residents.
meanings.sent3: Imagine if we could municipalize the entire forest and turn it into a beautiful town!
meanings.sent4: The dream to municipalize the island and create a self-sustaining community is becoming a reality.
meanings.sent5: Their vision is to municipalize the desert and build a thriving city from scratch.

meanings.definition: To transfer from private to municipal ownership or control.
meanings.sent1: The decision to municipalize the power plant was a significant step towards sustainability.
meanings.sent2: The company agreed to municipalize the public park for the benefit of the community.
meanings.sent3: It was a strange sight to see the city municipalize the old factory building.
meanings.sent4: The move to municipalize the historic theater brought new life to the downtown area.
meanings.sent5: The effort to municipalize the abandoned warehouse was met with enthusiasm from the locals.
